resources.string: Turku Castle (Finnish: Turun linna, Swedish: Åbo slott) is a medieval castle in Turku. It is one of the oldest buildings still in use in Finland and is the largest surviving medieval building in Finland. It was founded in the late 13th century and stands on the banks of the Aura River.

Turku Cathedral (Finnish: Turun tuomiokirkko) is the Mother Church of the Evangelical Lutheran Church of Finland. It is the seat of the Archbishop of Finland and also regarded as one of the major records of Finnish architectural history as well as the most important religious building in Finland. The cathedral is situated in the heart of Turku next to the Old Great Square, by the river Aura.

The University of Turku (in Finnish Turun yliopisto, shortened in UTU) is the second largest university in the country as measured by student enrollment, after University of Helsinki. It was established in 1920 and also has faculties at Rauma, Pori and Salo. The university is a member of the Coimbra Group.
Luostarinmäki Handicrafts Museum (Finnish: Luostarinmäen käsityöläismuseo) is an open-air museum in Turku, where you can see many old houses and old Finnish handicrafts.

Turku Main Library (Finnish: Turun kaupunginkirjaston pääkirjasto) is the chief branch of Turku City Library, located in the city centre of the city. The library is approximately 8,500 m² and contains books and other printed and media materials in many languages of the world.
Turku Market Hall is the second oldest market hall in Finland, and it was opened in 1896.
The Tall Ships Races sailing event is coming to Turku in July. The races is one of the most impressive events held in the port-city of Turku.

Ruisrock is a rock festival held annually on the island of Ruissalo in Turku. Ruisrock, founded in 1970, is the second oldest rock festival in Europe (after Pinkpop) and the oldest in Finland. The festival has attracted world-famous artists throughout its lifetime except around the start of the 2000s (decade), due to the organizer\'s economic issues.
Usually held in July Turku Castle Tournament brings armoured warriors to the Castle\’s Park competing in different medieval combat disciplines.
More than 6,000 European folk dancers and musicians get together in Turku in July.
